dict.desc: Full storage location identifier (e.g., rank, GPU ID)

SymbolicProperty.desc: The total allocated size of the array. Can be used for padding.

int.desc: Allocation alignment in bytes (0 uses compiler-default)

SubsetProperty.desc: Subset of elements to move from the data attached to this edge.

DataProperty.desc: Data descriptor attached to this memlet

LambdaProperty.desc: If set, defines a write-conflict resolution lambda function. The syntax of the lambda function receives two elements: `current` value and `new` value, and returns the value after resolution

DataInstrumentationType.desc: Instrument data contents at this access

set.desc: Environments required by CMake to build and run this code node.

InstrumentationType.desc: Measure execution statistics with given method

LibraryImplementationProperty.desc: Which implementation this library node will expand into.Must match a key in the list of possible implementations.

Property.desc: A scalar which will be multiplied with A @ B before adding C

TilingType.desc: normal: the outerloop increments with tile_size, ceilrange: uses ceiling(N/tile_size) in outer range, number_of_tiles: tiles the map into the number of provided tiles, provide the number of tiles over tile_size

allow_conflicts.desc: If enabled, allows more than one memlet to write to the same memory location without conflict resolution.

strides.desc: For each dimension, the number of elements to skip in order to obtain the next element in that dimension.

total_size.desc: The total allocated size of the array. Can be used for padding.

offset.desc: Initial offset to translate all indices by.

may_alias.desc: This pointer may alias with other pointers in the same function

alignment.desc: Allocation alignment in bytes (0 uses compiler-default)

start_offset.desc: Allocation offset elements for manual alignment (pre-padding)

volume.desc: The exact number of elements moved using this memlet, or the maximum number if dynamic=True (with 0 as unbounded)

dynamic.desc: Is the number of elements moved determined at runtime (e.g., data dependent)

subset.desc: Subset of elements to move from the data attached to this edge.

debuginfo.desc: Line information to track source and generated code

wcr_nonatomic.desc: If True, always generates non-conflicting (non-atomic) writes in resulting code

executions.desc: The number of times this state gets executed (0 stands for unbounded)

dynamic_executions.desc: The number of executions of this state is dynamic

location.desc: Full storage location identifier (e.g., rank, GPU ID)

is_subgrid.desc: If true, spanws sub-grids out of the parent process-grid.

parent_grid.desc: Name of the parent process-grid (mandatory if `is_subgrid` is true, otherwise ignored).

color.desc: The i-th entry specifies whether the i-th dimension is kept in the sub-grid or is dropped (mandatory if `is_subgrid` is true, otherwise ignored).

exact_grid.desc: If set then, out of all the sub-grids created, only the one that contains the rank with id `exact_grid` will be utilized for collective communication (optional if `is_subgrid` is true, otherwise ignored).

root.desc: The root rank for collective communication.

pgrid.desc: Name of the process-grid where the data are distributed.

correspondence.desc: Correspondence of the array's indices to the process grid's indices.

nodes.desc: Nodes in this group given by [State, Node] id tuples

states.desc: States in this group given by their ids

color.desc: Color for the group, given as a hexadecimal string

assignments.desc: Assignments to perform upon transition (e.g., 'x=x+1; y = 0')

arg_names.desc: Ordered argument names (used for calling conventions).

instrument.desc: Measure execution statistics with given method

global_code.desc: Code generated in a global scope on the output files.

logical_groups.desc: Logical groupings of nodes and edges

openmp_sections.desc: Whether to generate OpenMP sections in code

_rdistrarrays.desc: Sub-array redistribution descriptors for this SDFG

callback_mapping.desc: Mapping between callback name and its original callback (for when the same callback is used with a different signature)

no_init.desc: If enabled, does not create initialization states for reduce nodes with identity

dim_idx.desc: Index of dimension to be strip-mined

tile_size.desc: Tile size of strip-mined dimension, or number of tiles if tiling_type=number_of_tiles

tile_stride.desc: Stride between two tiles of the strip-mined dimension. If zero, it is set equal to the tile size.

divides_evenly.desc: Tile size divides dimension range evenly?

strided.desc: Continuous (false) or strided (true) elements in tile

tiling_type.desc: normal: the outerloop increments with tile_size, ceilrange: uses ceiling(N/tile_size) in outer range, number_of_tiles: tiles the map into the number of provided tiles, provide the number of tiles over tile_size

skew.desc: If True, offsets inner tile back such that it starts with zero

strides.desc: Tile stride (enables overlapping tiles). If empty, matches tile

divides_evenly.desc: Tile size divides dimension length evenly

strides.desc: Tile stride (enables overlapping tiles). If empty, matches tile

divides_evenly.desc: Tile size divides dimension length evenly

propagate_parent.desc: Propagate vector length through parent SDFGs

strided_map.desc: Use strided map range (jump by vector length) instead of modifying memlets

preamble.desc: Force creation or skipping a preamble map without vectors

postamble.desc: Force creation or skipping a postamble map without vectors

with_buffer.desc: Use an intermediate buffer for accumulation

array.desc: Array to create local storage for (if empty, first available)
Array to create local storage for (if empty, first available)

create_array.desc: if false, it does not create a new array.

array.desc: Array to create local storage for (if empty, first available)

create_array.desc: if false, it does not create a new array.

array.desc: Array to create local storage for (if empty, first available)

create_array.desc: if false, it does not create a new array.

buffer_size.desc: Set buffer size for the newly-created stream

storage.desc: Set storage type for the newly-created stream

use_memory_buffering.desc: Set if memory buffering should be used.

memory_buffering_target_bytes.desc: Set bytes read/written from memory if memory buffering is enabled.

buffer_size.desc: Set buffer size for the newly-created stream

storage.desc: Set storage type for the newly-created stream

reduce_implementation.desc: Reduce implementation of inner reduce. If specified,overrides any existing implementations

remove_unused_containers.desc: If True, remove unused containers from parent SDFG.

fullcopy.desc: Copy whole arrays rather than used subset

register_trans.desc: Make all transients inside GPU maps registers

fullcopy.desc: Copy whole arrays rather than used subset

nested_seq.desc: Makes nested code semantically-equivalent to single-core code,transforming nested maps and memory into sequential and local memory respectively.

replicate_maps.desc: Replicate tiled maps that lead to multiple other tiled maps

split_array_info.desc: Describes how many times this array is split in each dimension, where the k-th number describes how many times dimension k is split. If the k-th number is 1 this means that the array is not split in the k-th dimension at all. If None, then the transform will split the first dimension exactly shape[0] times.

default_to_storage.desc: The storage type of involved arrays will be set to the value of this property if they have Default storage type.

validate.desc: Validate the sdfg and the nested sdfg

include_in_assignment.desc: Wether to include global variable assignments of the edge going into the kernel inside the kernel or have it happen on the outside. If the assignment is needed in the kernel, it needs to be included.

kernel_prefix.desc: Name of the kernel. If no value is given the kerenl will be refrenced as `kernel`, if a value is given the kernel will be named `<kernel_prefix>_kernel`. This is useful if multiple kernels are created.

state_id.desc: ID of state to transform subgraph within, or -1 to transform the SDFG

sequential_innermaps.desc: Make all inner maps that arecreated during expansion sequential

check_contiguity.desc: Don't allow expansion if last (contiguous)dimension is partially split

permutation_only.desc: Only allow permutations without inner splits

state_id.desc: ID of state to transform subgraph within, or -1 to transform the SDFG

transient_allocation.desc: Storage Location to push transients to that are fully contained within the subgraph.

schedule_innermaps.desc: Schedule of inner maps. If none, keeps schedule.

consolidate.desc: Consolidate edges that enter and exit the fused map.

propagate.desc: Propagate memlets of edges that enter and exit the fused map.Disable if this causes problems (e.g., if memlet propagation doesnot work correctly).

disjoint_subsets.desc: Check for disjoint subsets in can_be_applied. If multipleaccess nodes pointing to the same data appear within a subgraphto be fused, this check confirms that their access sets areindependent per iteration space to avoid race conditions.

keep_global.desc: A list of array names to treat as non-transients and not compress

state_id.desc: ID of state to transform subgraph within, or -1 to transform the SDFG

promote_global_trans.desc: If True, transient arrays that are fully internal are pulled out so that they can be allocated on the host.

register_trans.desc: Make all transients inside GPU maps registers

skip_scalar_tasklets.desc: If True, does not transform tasklets that manipulate (Default-stored) scalars

exclude_copyin.desc: Exclude these arrays from being copied into the device (comma-separated)

exclude_tasklets.desc: Exclude these tasklets from being processed as CPU tasklets (comma-separated)

exclude_copyout.desc: Exclude these arrays from being copied out of the device (comma-separated)

promote_global_trans.desc: Promotes transients to be allocated once

count.desc: Number of iterations to unroll, or zero for all iterations (loop must be constant-sized for 0)

begin.desc: If True, peels loop from beginning (first `count` iterations), otherwise peels last `count` iterations.

count.desc: Number of iterations to unroll, or zero for all iterations (loop must be constant-sized for 0)

itervar.desc: The name of the iteration variable (optional).

prefix.desc: Prefix for new inner tiled range symbols

schedule.desc: Dace.Dtypes.ScheduleType of Inner Maps

unroll_loops.desc: Unroll Inner Loops if they have Size > 1

state_id.desc: ID of state to transform subgraph within, or -1 to transform the SDFG

transient_allocation.desc: Storage Location to push transients to that are fully contained within the subgraph.

stencil_unroll_loops.desc: Unroll inner stencil loops if they have size > 1

expansion_split.desc: Allow MultiExpansion to split up maps, if enabled

state_id.desc: ID of state to transform subgraph within, or -1 to transform the SDFG
